item.title: 最高法院裁定：欧盟对 Illumina-Grail 交易的调查是错误的
item.description: 根据最高法院的一项裁决，Illumina 公司放弃以 70 亿美元收购癌症检测提供商 Grail 公司的交易本不应受到欧盟的调查，该裁决触及了欧盟试图审查更多全球交易的核心问题。【原文：Illumina Inc.’s abandoned $7 billion bid for cancer-detection provider Grail Inc. should never have been probed by the European Union, according to a top court ruling that strikes at the heart of the EU’s attempt to vet more global deals.】

item.title: 沙特财富基金今年第四次进入债券市场
item.description: 沙特阿拉伯主权财富基金正准备在今年第四次向债券投资者募集资金，以资助其庞大的国内投资计划。【原文：Saudi Arabia’s sovereign wealth fund is preparing to tap bond investors for a fourth time this year as it looks to finance its huge domestic investment plans.】

item.title: 国泰航空为何调查其 A350 机队
item.description: 国泰航空公司（Cathay Pacific Airways Ltd.）周二发现一架空中客车A350飞机的发动机出现故障，因此取消了数十个航班。由于在飞行途中发现故障，这架飞往苏黎世的航班被迫返回国泰航空在香港的基地。【原文：Cathay Pacific Airways Ltd. canceled dozens of flights Tuesday after detecting an engine fault in one of its Airbus SE A350 aircraft. The mid-flight discovery of the problem forced the Zurich-bound flight to return to the carrier’s base in Hong Kong.】

item.title: 英国海上风电拍卖价格上涨，Orsted 占据主导地位
item.description: 丹麦的 Orsted A/S 公司是英国最近一次支持新建海上风电场拍卖的最大赢家。【原文：Denmark’s Orsted A/S was the biggest winner in the latest UK auction to support new offshore wind farms.】

item.title: 印度 2.34 亿美元加密货币被盗背后的黑客开始清洗资金
item.description: 印度最严重加密货币黑客攻击事件的幕后黑手已开始清洗 WazirX 交易所在此次事件中被盗的 2.34 亿美元中的部分资金。【原文：The attacker behind India’s worst crypto hack has begun laundering some of the $234 million stolen in the incident from the WazirX exchange, acting the same day the platform briefed on efforts to recover funds.】

item.title: 罗马尼亚股市反弹 40% 使其成为全球市场的佼佼者
item.description: 罗马尼亚股市正成为欧洲表现最出色的股市之一，随着更多公司有望上市，投资者对股市进一步反弹持乐观态度。【原文：Romania’s stock market is becoming one of Europe’s star performers, with investors upbeat about the rally running further as more companies are expected to go public.】

item.title: 埃塞俄比亚航空公司停飞厄立特里亚航班，表明两国关系日渐式微
item.description: 非洲最大的航空公司埃塞俄比亚航空集团暂停了飞往厄立特里亚的航班，这是与邻国埃塞俄比亚关系恶化的最新迹象。【原文：Ethiopian Airlines Group, Africa’s biggest carrier, suspended flights to Eritrea in the latest sign of deteriorating relations with neighboring Ethiopia.】

item.title: 尽管新反应堆延期，法国电力集团仍上调核电产量预测
item.description: 法国电力公司（Electricite de France SA）上调了法国 2024 年的核电生产预测，但将一座新核电站的并网时间推迟了几个月。【原文：Electricite de France SA raised its French nuclear production forecast for 2024, but delayed connecting a new atomic plant to the grid by a few months.】

item.title: 土耳其加息后通胀大幅放缓
item.description: 由于 50%的借贷成本影响到经济并抑制了需求，土耳其 8 月份的年度通胀率大幅下降。【原文：Turkey’s annual inflation eased sharply in August, as effects of 50% borrowing costs filter through to the economy and dampen demand.】

item.title: 德国股市创纪录，与国家经济阴霾背道而驰
item.description: 德国上一季度经济萎缩，最大的贸易伙伴之一岌岌可危，政府极不受欢迎。然而，该国的基准股指却刚刚创下历史新高。【原文：Germany’s economy shrank last quarter, one of its biggest trading partners is ailing and the government is deeply unpopular. And yet the country’s benchmark stock index just made a record high.】

item.title: 欧盟称将开始打捞红海中燃烧的油轮
item.description: 欧盟驻该地区的海军部队说，一艘被胡塞武装袭击的油轮在红海燃烧多日，打捞工作即将开始。【原文：Salvage operations for a Houthi-hit oil tanker that’s been burning in the Red Sea for days is set to begin soon, the European Union’s naval force in the region said.】

item.title: 埃及关键商业指数自 2020 年以来首次扩张
item.description: 埃及非石油私营部门的活动在近四年来首次出现增长，这表明在北非国家经历了几十年来最严重的经济危机之后，脆弱的复苏可能正在形成。【原文：Activity in Egypt’s non-oil private sector expanded for the first time in almost four years, signaling a fragile recovery may be taking hold after the North African nation’s worst economic crisis in decades.】

item.title: 日本功能失调的债券市场出现更多复苏迹象
item.description: 日本央行的一项调查显示，尽管十多年来激进的宽松货币政策削弱了投资者积极交易的动力，但日本债券市场仍然功能失调，持续改善的迹象正在显现。【原文：More signs of sustained improvement are appearing in Japan’s bond market, even though it remains dysfunctional after over a decade of radical monetary easing reduced the incentive for investors to trade actively, according to a Bank of Japan survey.】

item.title: 瑞士通胀放缓，瑞士央行准备 9 月降息
item.description: 瑞士 8 月份通胀放缓幅度超过预期，为再次降息提供了支持。【原文：Swiss inflation slowed more than expected in August, supporting the case for another interest-rate cut.】

item.title: 台湾收购目标公司新光集团上半年盈利反弹
item.description: 面临竞争对手收购的台湾企业新光金控公司（Shin Kong Financial Holding Co.【原文：Shin Kong Financial Holding Co., the Taiwanese firm facing rival takeover bids, said net income reached NT$20.5 billion ($638 million) in the first half of 2024, compared with a year-earlier loss.】

item.title: 瑞士银行监管机构希望获得干预业务模式的权力
item.description: 瑞士金融监管局（Finma）负责人表示，瑞士银行业监管机构需要拥有在没有严重危机的情况下也能干预贷款机构业务模式的权力。【原文：Switzerland’s banking watchdog needs the power to be able to intervene in lenders’ business models even in the absence of an acute crisis, according to the head of Financial Supervision Authority Finma.】

item.title: 非洲最大的杂货商将家具业务出售给竞争对手 Pepkor
item.description: 非洲最大的连锁超市 Shoprite Holdings Ltd. 将把其家具部门出售给一家规模较小的竞争对手，同时专注于扩大其服装、婴儿用品、户外用品和宠物用品专卖店。【原文：Shoprite Holdings Ltd. will sell its furniture unit to a smaller rival as Africa’s largest supermarket chain focuses on expanding its specialist-clothing, baby, outdoor and pet stores.】

item.title: 英国在绿色拍卖会上大举支持海上风电
item.description: 英国将支持新建 4.9 千兆瓦的海上风电场，因为在去年拍卖失败后，政府试图重振该行业。【原文：Britain will support 4.9 gigawatts of new offshore wind farms as the government tries to revive the sector after a failed auction last year.】

item.title: 富时 100 指数直播： 英镑重拾跌势，反弹势头减弱
美国交易员假期归来，美元连续第五天攀升
item.description: 美元连续第五个交易日反弹，原因是美国交易员准备从假期中返回，迎接本周经济数据的密集发布。【原文：The dollar extended its rebound to a fifth straight session as US traders readied their return from a holiday to a week packed with economic data.】

item.title: 中国股市跌破关键支撑位，贷款人纷纷撤退
item.description: 随着对中国金融业状况的担忧加深，中国的一个重要股票指标跌破了一个受到密切关注的临界点。【原文：A key Chinese stock gauge fell below a closely watched threshold as concerns deepened over the state of the nation’s financial sector.】

item.title: 联合国在的黎波里举行会谈以解决利比亚中央银行危机
item.description: 联合国称，利比亚敌对政府周一举行了会谈，试图解决该国中央银行的危机，这场危机引发了对这个欧佩克国家石油生产和出口的封锁。【原文：The United Nations said it held talks between Libya’s rival governments on Monday in an attempt to resolve a crisis at the country’s central bank that has triggered a blockade of oil production and exports from the OPEC nation.】

item.title: 开始一天生活所需的五件事欧洲
item.description:
及时了解市场监测情况

Get up to speed with what the markets are monitoring

】

item.title: 波兰加强国有企业治理，避免资产出售
item.description: 在上届民族主义政府大幅提升了国家在经济中的作用之后，波兰政府没有计划将任何重要资产卖回私人手中。【原文：Poland’s government has no plans to sell any major assets back into private hands after the previous nationalist administration significantly boosted the state’s role in the economy.】

item.title: 波兰部长表示，波兰寻求重新思考而非阻止煤炭分拆上市
item.description: 负责管理国有资产的部长表示，波兰正在寻求修改公用事业公司分拆煤炭资产的计划。【原文：Poland is seeking to amend plans for utilities to spin off their coal assets, according to the minister in charge of managing state assets.】

item.title: 印尼寻求 1,000 万桶石油以建立首个储备
item.description: 印尼计划在未来十年预留1000多万桶原油（约占全球日消费量的十分之一），作为应对能源冲击的缓冲。【原文：Indonesia plans to set aside more than 10 million barrels of crude — about a 10th of global daily consumption — over the next decade as a buffer against energy shocks.】

item.title: 中国需求疲软，高盛下调铜价预期
item.description: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc.【原文：China’s increasingly disappointing economic recovery will delay an expected rally in copper, said Goldman Sachs Group Inc. as it slashed its forecast for next year by almost $5,000 a ton.】

item.title: 一旦关键利率接近 3%，欧洲央行减息将变得更加棘手
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，一旦利率降至 3% 左右，欧洲央行的决策将变得更具争议性，而且在如何控制通胀的问题上也会出现冲突。【原文：Decisions at the European Central Bank are set to get a lot more contentious once interest rates fall to about 3% and clashes emerge over what’s still needed to keep inflation in check, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 丹斯克称诺和诺德将为 2024 年丹麦经济增长提供一半动力
item.description: 据丹麦最大的银行称，诺和诺德公司（Novo Nordisk A/S）今年可能为丹麦的经济扩张贡献一半左右的力量，帮助丹麦超越北欧邻国。【原文：Novo Nordisk A/S is likely to contribute about half of Denmark’s economic expansion this year, helping the nation to outperform its Nordic neighbors, according to the country’s largest bank.】

item.title: 中国将对加拿大油菜籽发起反倾销调查
item.description: 中国商务部在一份声明中表示，中国将对加拿大进口油菜籽发起反倾销调查。【原文：China will launch an anti-dumping probe into Canadian rapeseed imports, the country’s Ministry of Commerce said in a statement.】
